title: Mine king level
data:
The **mine king level** is a special level in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") that is one level below [Mines' End](/wiki/Mines%27_End "Mines' End"). It is reached by a staircase found in one of the possible positions for the [luckstone](/wiki/Luckstone "Luckstone") in Mines' End.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"Update to reflect SlashTHEM/Hack'EM"*

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Level](#Level)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 See also](#See_also)

## Level

                   #                      #                  #              
                  ##                    #####          #######              
                  #                         #          #     #              
    ###############  ###           ######   #      #####     ########       
    #             ####             #        #      #                        
    #          ####      ##########[<](/wiki/Staircase "Staircase")##########    ##  -----------      ###  
  #########    #  ########         #         #     #  |GGGG[\\](/wiki/Throne "Throne")GGGG|      #    
         #     #              ######       ###     #  |GGGGGGGGG|   ####    
        ##     #              #           ## #######  |GGGGGGGGG|  ##  #    
        #      ####   #       ########    #  #     #  -----[+](/wiki/Door "Door")-----      #    
               #      #########      #    #  #             #           #    
          #######          #  #  #####       ###############       #####    
          #  #       ########    #        #    #       #           #   #    
             #       #        ######     #########    ##############        
                     #     ####  #       #       #           #              
                           #                                 #            

[Ruggo the Gnome King](/wiki/Ruggo_the_Gnome_King "Ruggo the Gnome King") is on his throne and carries a random weapon, a random wand, two random potions, and a random piece of armor. There are also 26 random G in the throne room (shown as G on the above map). There are 20 gnomes and eleven [gnome warriors](/wiki/Gnome_warrior "Gnome warrior") roaming the level, and scattered throughout the level are 40 random gems, 20 piles of gold, and a pick-axe.

## Strategy

Always use telepathy to check any gray G that appear in the throne room: it is possible that they are [gnolls](/wiki/Gnoll#SLASH.27EM "Gnoll"), which can easily dispatch most players just reaching the level for the first time. Gnolls naturally [hide](/wiki/Hide "Hide"), meaning they will not come out and attack you, but if you bump into them or find them through [automatic searching](/wiki/Automatic_searching "Automatic searching"), they will attack.

Apart from potential gnolls, Ruggo himself can be dangerous, as he is guaranteed to generate with a wand, which may be something nasty like a [wand of fire](/wiki/Wand_of_fire "Wand of fire"). Additionally, the gnome warriors, while not individually a huge threat, can wear down your HP faster than one might expect: keep a close eye on your health.

## History

The Mine king level is identical to the home level of the defunct [Gnome quest](/wiki/Gnome_quest "Gnome quest") from [SLASH 6](/wiki/SLASH_6 "SLASH 6"), of which Ruggo the Gnome King was the [quest leader](/wiki/Quest_leader "Quest leader"). The guaranteed pick-axe may also serve as an allusion to that quest's artifact, [the Pick of Flandal Steelskin](/wiki/Gnome_quest#The_Pick_of_Flandal_Steelskin "Gnome quest").

## See also

- [Special level (SLASH'EM)](/wiki/Special_level_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Special level (SLASH'EM)")

html:
Mine king level

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The mine king level is a special level in SLASH'EM, SlashTHEM and Hack'EM that is one level below Mines' End. It is reached by a staircase found in one of the possible positions for the luckstone in Mines' End.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"Update to reflect SlashTHEM/Hack'EM"

Contents

  • 1 Level
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 See also

Level

    #             ####             #        #      #                      
    #          ####      ##########<##########    ##  -----------      ###

                           #                                 #            

Ruggo the Gnome King is on his throne and carries a random weapon, a random wand, two random potions, and a random piece of armor. There are also 26 random G in the throne room (shown as G on the above map). There are 20 gnomes and eleven gnome warriors roaming the level, and scattered throughout the level are 40 random gems, 20 piles of gold, and a pick-axe.

Strategy

Always use telepathy to check any gray G that appear in the throne room: it is possible that they are gnolls, which can easily dispatch most players just reaching the level for the first time. Gnolls naturally hide, meaning they will not come out and attack you, but if you bump into them or find them through automatic searching, they will attack.

Apart from potential gnolls, Ruggo himself can be dangerous, as he is guaranteed to generate with a wand, which may be something nasty like a wand of fire. Additionally, the gnome warriors, while not individually a huge threat, can wear down your HP faster than one might expect: keep a close eye on your health.

History

The Mine king level is identical to the home level of the defunct Gnome quest from SLASH 6, of which Ruggo the Gnome King was the quest leader. The guaranteed pick-axe may also serve as an allusion to that quest's artifact, the Pick of Flandal Steelskin.

See also

  • Special level (SLASH'EM)

The '''mine king level''' is a special level in [[SLASH'EM]], [[SlashTHEM]] and [[Hack'EM]] that is one level below [[Mines' End]]. It is reached by a staircase found in one of the possible positions for the [[luckstone]] in Mines' End. {{todo|Update to reflect SlashTHEM/Hack'EM}} ==Level==

[[Ruggo the Gnome King]] is on his throne and carries a random weapon, a random wand, two random potions, and a random piece of armor. There are also 26 random G in the throne room (shown as {{lightgray|G}} on the above map). There are 20 gnomes and eleven [[gnome warrior]]s roaming the level, and scattered throughout the level are 40 random gems, 20 piles of gold, and a pick-axe. ==Strategy== Always use telepathy to check any gray {{gray|G}} that appear in the throne room: it is possible that they are [[Gnoll#SLASH'EM|gnolls]], which can easily dispatch most players just reaching the level for the first time. Gnolls naturally [[hide]], meaning they will not come out and attack you, but if you bump into them or find them through [[automatic searching]], they will attack. Apart from potential gnolls, Ruggo himself can be dangerous, as he is guaranteed to generate with a wand, which may be something nasty like a [[wand of fire]]. Additionally, the gnome warriors, while not individually a huge threat, can wear down your HP faster than one might expect: keep a close eye on your health. ==History== The Mine king level is identical to the home level of the defunct [[Gnome quest]] from [[SLASH 6]], of which Ruggo the Gnome King was the [[quest leader]]. The guaranteed pick-axe may also serve as an allusion to that quest's artifact, [[Gnome quest#The Pick of Flandal Steelskin|the Pick of Flandal Steelskin]]. ==See also== *[[Special level (SLASH'EM)]] {{slashem-7E7|offset=1}} {{variant-343}} [[Category:SLASH'EM special levels]] [[Category:SlashTHEM special levels]] [[Category:Hack'EM special levels]]
